synonyms: śyāma-sundara—Lord Kṛṣṇa, who has a bluish color; śikhi-piccha—with a peacock feather on the head; guñjā—a garland of guñjā (small berries or conchshells); vibhūṣaṇa—decorations; gopa-veśa—with the dress of a cowherd boy; tri-bhaṅgima—curved in three places; muralī-vadana—holding a flute to His mouth.
translation: He has a bluish complexion, a peacock feather on His head, a guñjā garland and the decorations of a cowherd boy. His body is curved in three places, and He holds a flute to His mouth.
